Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek (North Ionian?) pottery plate. Glaze fired red. Two bands preserved outside. Inside, frieze of spirals linked by triple lines with palmette leaves above and below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the decorative pattern compare British Museum 1888,0601.499.a with Boston MFA 88.1085.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 10 pl. 2.19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.775)
